title: Jeffery Broadwater
text:
Jeffery D. Broadwater (born 1967) is a <a href="United%20States%20Army">United States Army</a> <a href="Major%20general%20%28United%20States%29">major general</a> who serves as deputy commanding general of <a href="V%20Corps%20%28United%20States%29">V Corps</a>. He previously served as commanding general of the <a href="1st%20Cavalry%20Division%20%28United%20States%29">1st Cavalry Division</a> from October 3, 2019 to July 21, 2021. Prior to that, he served as commanding general of the <a href="Fort%20Irwin%20National%20Training%20Center">Fort Irwin National Training Center</a> from November 2016 to September 2019.
Broadwater was among 14 <a href="Fort%20Hood">Fort Hood</a> military leaders fired or suspended from duty by then-<a href="United%20States%20Secretary%20of%20the%20Army">Secretary of the Army</a> <a href="Ryan%20D.%20McCarthy">Ryan D. McCarthy</a> for creating a "permissive environment" that let crimes up to sexual harassment and assault occur with little punitive action, per an investigation into the <a href="Killing%20of%20Vanessa%20Guill%C3%A9n">death of Vanessa Guillén</a>. He ultimately did not face any disciplinary action, but was consequently not present at the 1st Cavalry's change of command ceremony in July 2021.
